intro: Linaria tursica, commonly known as the Turkish toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while the flowers are tubular with two lips, typical of the genus Linaria. Linaria tursica is often found in rocky soils and dry habitats, making it a resilient and ornamental species in gardens.
